info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 7:58PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Schenectady and southeastern Saratoga Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 758 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over East Glenville, or over Scotia, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Schenectady, Clifton Park, Saratoga Springs, Scotia, Mechanicville, Niskayuna, Ballston Spa, Round Lake, Country Knolls, North Ballston Spa, Alplaus, East Glenville, Burnt Hills, Malta, Stillwater, Glenridge, Harding Crossing, Willow Glen, Coons and Garrison Manor. People attending Saratoga Performing Arts Center (SPAC) should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes the following highways... Interstate 890 near exit 1a, and between exits 4b and 4c, and near exit 6. Interstate 87 between exits 9 and 13N. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central New York.
